array_width.description:
Maximum width of an array literal before falling back to vertical formatting.

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#array_width)

attr_fn_like_width.description:
Maximum width of the args of a function-like attributes before falling back to vertical formatting.

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#attr_fn_like_width)

binop_separator.description:
Where to put a binary operator when a binary expression goes multiline

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#binop_separator)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

blank_lines_lower_bound.description:
Minimum number of blank lines which must be put between items

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#blank_lines_lower_bound)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

blank_lines_upper_bound.description:
Maximum number of blank lines which can be put between items

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#blank_lines_upper_bound)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

brace_style.description:
Brace style for items

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#brace_style)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

chain_width.description:
Maximum length of a chain to fit on a single line.

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#chain_width)

color.description:
What Color option to use when none is supplied: Always, Never, Auto

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#color)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

combine_control_expr.description:
Combine control expressions with function calls

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#combine_control_expr)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

comment_width.description:
Maximum length of comments. No effect unless wrap_comments = true

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#comment_width)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

condense_wildcard_suffixes.description:
Replace strings of _ wildcards by a single .. in tuple patterns

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#condense_wildcard_suffixes)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

control_brace_style.description:
Brace style for control flow constructs

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#control_brace_style)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

emit_mode.description:
What emit Mode to use when none is supplied

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#emit_mode)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

empty_item_single_line.description:
Put empty-body functions and impls on a single line

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#empty_item_single_line)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

enum_discrim_align_threshold.description:
Align enum variants discrims, if their diffs fit within threshold

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#enum_discrim_align_threshold)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

error_on_line_overflow.description:
Error if unable to get all lines within max_width

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#error_on_line_overflow)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

error_on_unformatted.description:
Error if unable to get comments or string literals within max_width, or they are left with trailing whitespaces

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#error_on_unformatted)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

fn_args_layout.description:
Control the layout of arguments in a function

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#fn_args_layout)

fn_call_width.description:
Maximum width of the args of a function call before falling back to vertical formatting.

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#fn_call_width)

fn_single_line.description:
Put single-expression functions on a single line

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#fn_single_line)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

force_explicit_abi.description:
Always print the abi for extern items

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#force_explicit_abi)

force_multiline_blocks.description:
Force multiline closure bodies and match arms to be wrapped in a block

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#force_multiline_blocks)

This option requires Nightly Rust.

format_code_in_doc_comments.description:
Format the code snippet in doc comments.

This option requires Nightly Rust.

format_generated_files.description:
Format generated files

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

format_macro_bodies.description:
Format the bodies of macros

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#format_macro_bodies)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

format_macro_matchers.description:
Format the metavariable matching patterns in macros

This option requires Nightly Rust.

format_strings.description:
Format string literals where necessary

This option requires Nightly Rust.

group_imports.description:

This option requires Nightly Rust.

Use tab characters for indentation, spaces for alignment

hex_literal_case.description:
Format hexadecimal integer literals

This option requires Nightly Rust.

hide_parse_errors.description:
Hide errors from the parser

This option requires Nightly Rust.

ignore.description:
Skip formatting the specified files and directories

This option requires Nightly Rust.

imports_granularity.description:
Merge or split imports to the provided granularity

This option requires Nightly Rust.

imports_indent.description:
Indent of imports

This option requires Nightly Rust.

imports_layout.description:
Item layout inside a import block

This option requires Nightly Rust.

indent_style.description:
How do we indent expressions or items

This option requires Nightly Rust.

inline_attribute_width.description:
Write an item and its attribute on the same line if their combined width is below a threshold

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

license_template_path.description:
Beginning of file must match license template

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#license_template_path)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

make_backup.description:
Backup changed files

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#make_backup)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

match_arm_blocks.description:
Wrap the body of arms in blocks when it does not fit on the same line with the pattern of arms

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#match_arm_blocks)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

match_arm_leading_pipes.description:
Determines whether leading pipes are emitted on match arms

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#match_arm_leading_pipes)

match_block_trailing_comma.description:
Put a trailing comma after a block based match arm (non-block arms are not affected)

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#match_block_trailing_comma)

merge_derives.description:
Merge multiple `#[derive(...)]` into a single one

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#merge_derives)

normalize_comments.description:
Convert /* */ comments to // comments where possible

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#normalize_comments)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

normalize_doc_attributes.description:
Normalize doc attributes as doc comments

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#normalize_doc_attributes)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

overflow_delimited_expr.description:
Allow trailing bracket/brace delimited expressions to overflow

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#overflow_delimited_expr)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

print_misformatted_file_names.description:
Prints the names of mismatched files that were formatted. Prints the names of files that would be formated when used with `--check` mode.

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#print_misformatted_file_names)

reorder_impl_items.description:
Reorder impl items

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#reorder_impl_items)

This option requires Nightly Rust.

reorder_imports.description:
Reorder import and extern crate statements alphabetically

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#reorder_imports)

reorder_modules.description:
Reorder module statements alphabetically in group

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#reorder_modules)

report_fixme.description:
Report all, none or unnumbered occurrences of FIXME in source file comments

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#report_fixme)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

report_todo.description:
Report all, none or unnumbered occurrences of TODO in source file comments

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#report_todo)

This option requires Nightly Rust.

required_version.description:
Require a specific version of rustfmt

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

single_line_if_else_max_width.description:
Maximum line length for single line if-else expressions. A value of zero means always break if-else expressions.

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#single_line_if_else_max_width)

skip_children.description:
Don't reformat out of line modules

This option requires Nightly Rust.

space_after_colon.description:
Leave a space after the colon

This option requires Nightly Rust.

space_before_colon.description:
Leave a space before the colon

This option requires Nightly Rust.

spaces_around_ranges.description:
Put spaces around the  .. and ..= range operators

This option requires Nightly Rust.

struct_field_align_threshold.description:
Align struct fields if their diffs fits within threshold

This option requires Nightly Rust.

Put small struct literals on a single line

This option requires Nightly Rust.

struct_lit_width.description:
Maximum width in the body of a struct lit before falling back to vertical formatting.

struct_variant_width.description:
Maximum width in the body of a struct variant before falling back to vertical formatting.

trailing_comma.description:
How to handle trailing commas for lists

This option requires Nightly Rust.

trailing_semicolon.description:
Add trailing semicolon after break, continue and return

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

type_punctuation_density.description:
Determines if '+' or '=' are wrapped in spaces in the punctuation of types

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#type_punctuation_density)

### Unstable
This option requires Nightly Rust.

unstable_features.description:
Enables unstable features. Only available on nightly channel

This option requires Nightly Rust.

use_field_init_shorthand.description:
Use field initialization shorthand if possible

[Documentation](https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/#use_field_init_shorthand)

use_small_heuristics.description:
Whether to use different formatting for items and expressions if they satisfy a heuristic notion of 'small'

use_try_shorthand.description:
Replace uses of the try! macro by the ? shorthand

version.description:
Version of formatting rules

This option requires Nightly Rust.

where_single_line.description:
Force where-clauses to be on a single line

This option requires Nightly Rust.

wrap_comments.description:
Break comments to fit on the line
